meanings.definition: A white grape variety used in winemaking.
meanings.sent1: The semillon adds a unique flavor to the wine.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy a glass of semillon with my dinner.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a bunch of semillon grapes from the vineyard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as refreshing as a chilled glass of semillon.
meanings.sent5: The semillon grape glistened in the sunlight, ready to be harvested.

meanings.definition: A dry white wine made from the semillon grape.
meanings.sent1: The semillon wine paired perfectly with the seafood dish.
meanings.sent2: I prefer semillon over chardonnay for its crisp taste.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a bottle of semillon out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as smooth as a sip of semillon.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of semillon filled the room, enticing everyone to take a sip.

meanings.sent1: The semillon grape is known for its golden color.
meanings.sent2: Farmers carefully harvest the ripe semillon grapes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to steal a semillon grape but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The vineyard was a sea of lush semillon grapes, ready for picking.
meanings.sent5: The juicy semillon grape burst with flavor when bitten into.
